page.title: 03WORKING ON THE LAND
page.content: Mr Roberts, a local dairy farmer,talked to us about our area. The soil is very good and has been drained.Some is first grade {arable} land, the rest excellent{pasture. } Most farms here are small dairy concerns, although, potatoes,sugar beet, fodder beet, and cereals are grown. The farms producing milk keep {Freisian}cows for maximum milk yields. Sheep have been tried but many drowned by falling into ditches.The Robert's farm is 130 acres with 70 milking cows. In the 19 years since he has farmed here the number of dairy concerns has dropped from 13 to 6.Mr Roberts still works 60 hours a week and usually works all seven days. He says that automation has not made his job easier, just more efficient.
